required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Parent Connectors in First Episode Psychosis (FEP)
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Parent Connectors in First Episode Psychosis (FEP)

brief_summary.textblock: This study proposes to adapt an evidence based peer parent navigator (PPN) intervention, called Parent Connectors, in which trained and supervised PPNs deliver weekly telephone-based support for six to nine months to parents or caregivers of all newly enrolled youth or young adults (Y/YA) in FEP services. This PPN model will be used to enhance the delivery of Coordinated Specialty Care (CSC) for Y/YA in New York's state program for FEP, called OnTrackNY (OTNY). This research project has potential to add value to the CSC model through the inclusion of a feasible, low burden intervention that may improve family participation in services and Y/YA outcomes. Using random assignment, this study will examine the feasibility and preliminary impact of an accelerator strategy—the inclusion of peer parent navigators or PPNs—in CSC teams.

primary_outcome.description: A 34 item self reported instrument designed to measure empowerment status. The scale measures levels of empowerment, such as family, service system and community, and is rated on a likert scale, scale, ranging from1 (not true at all) to 5 (very true). The FES produces scores for three subscales based on level of empowerment:Family (12 items), Service system (12 items), and Community/ Political (10 items).
100-point quantifiable scale determining patient engagement in healthcare

arm_group.description: trained and supervised PPNs deliver weekly telephone-based support for six to nine months to parents or caregivers of all newlyenrolled youth or young adults (Y/YA) in FEP services

intervention.description: Delivery of Coordinated Specialty Care (CSC) for Y/YA in New York's state program for FEP, called OnTrackNY (OTNY).
standard of care provided to youth following first episode of psychosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Parents or caregivers of all newlyenrolled youth or young adults (Y/YA) in FEP services
Exclusion Criteria:
- NA
